newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Bullish tech sends Taiwan stocks to higher close.
newsitem.headline: Bullish tech sends Taiwan stocks to higher close.

text.p: Heavily weighted electronics sector continued its upswing to send Taiwan stock index to a higher close on Friday, and brokers said the technology-led momentum would likely sustain in the near term.
The trendsetting electronics opened stronger with at least four technology shares reaching their uplimits in just 15 minutes, brokers said.

The sector finished 5.47 percent up to send the overall index to a higher close at 9,808.91, up 176.49 points or 1.83 percent, enabling the index to once again stand above the 9,800 level since July 21's 9,833.77 close.
Turnover was heavy at T$207.8 billion.
Brokers said the bullish trend cleared investors' worries that the sector's strong Thursday rebound could be short-lived.
Electronics rebounded 6.5 percent on Thursday after losing more than 15 percent in five previous sessions.
"Electronics are setting the trend. Everybody is betting on them now," said Lei Pei-yu, assistant manager of Pacific Securities.
Brokers said recent Wall Street rallies also helped fuel the bullish mood.
Wall Street and Nasdaq composites have risen for three consecutive sessions.
"Given the strong fundamental in the electronic sector, the sector is expected to maintain its uptrend in the near term," Ben Lee of Nomura Securities said.
More than 10 technology shares rose to the daily limit.
Chipmaker Taiwan Semiconductors was limit up at T$153, rising T$10, and strong rival United Microelectronics had also risen to the seven-percent daily limit to T$128, gaining T$8.
Acer Sertek, an arm of computer giant Acer Inc, was limit up at T$99, rising T$6.5, while notebook maker Inventec Corp had soared to its daily limit by T$14 to T$218.
Financials rebounded 1.68 percent with the "big three" state-run commercial banks all posting gains.
"As long as financials maintain their gains, and other sectors do not lose heavily, the index should be able to stand above the 9,900 level," said Albert Lin, manager of Golden Securities.
A 9,800-9,900 range was seen for Saturday.
